alert.note: Alert for Todd (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:15PM CDT until April 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Long Prairie River at Long Prairie affecting Todd County. .Warm temperatures will continue melting snowpack and increasing river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Long Prairie River at Long Prairie. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Commercial businesses are impacted on Riverside Drive and 1st Avenue SW. Sandbags deployed to protect commercial structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 AM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 04/08/1997. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
